author: ehu
msg: Resolve issue 1491: add failure information to svnversion_tests.py
* subversion/tests/clients/cmdline/svntest/actions.py
(run_and_verify_svnversion): New. Do checks like other
run_and_verify_* procedures
* subversion/tests/clients/cmdline/svnversion_tests.py:
(svnversion_test): rewrite to use new run_and_verify_svnversion.

author: dlr
msg: Grasping at ways to get libapr loaded for JNI.  Some of these changes
may be reverted at a later date, but including them for posterity now.
* subversion/bindings/swig/java/org/tigris/subversion/util/NativeResources.java
getInstance(): Additional JavaDoc.
initialize(): Added JavaDoc about possible UnsatisfiedLinkErrors (a
variety of LinkageError). Also, try explicitly loading APR to
avoid this "symbol not found" exception for apr_initialize().
Haven't got this working yet, and not sure that it's even the
Right direction.
* subversion/bindings/swig/swigutil_java.c
(svn_swig_java__libtool_hack): Reference apr_initialize() in an
unused function as a completely hackish means of including an
undefined reference to apr_initialize in libsvn_swig_java's .so
file.  This seems more like the Right direction, as it is along
the lines of what Apache httpd 2 does with build/make_exports.awk
to hack around libtool (thanks to Justin for the pointer to that).

author: dlr
msg: * www/project_links.html
Added patch from Barry Scott to include "WorkBench" and a new
section for bindings.  I'll probably re-work this second section to
just point over to bindings.html.

author: naked
msg: Apparently at the moment only 'svn:' properties are UTF8 encoded, both
as revision properties and as normal file properties. So talking about
being able to put binaries in Subversion properties is quite okay. So
my concerns were not necessary.
* doc/book/REVIEW: Removed entry.

author: cmpilato
msg: Fix broken cvs2svn links.
